snippet: Degenerate Art: The Attack on Modern Art in Nazi Germany, 1937,” a show at the Neue Galerie, is one of the few in an American museum in the past two decades to address the Nazi’s selective demonizing of art.
abstract: Holland Cotter reviews Degenerate Art: The Attack on Modern Art in Nazi Germany, 1937, at Neue Galerie.
lead_paragraph: Degenerate Art: The Attack on Modern Art in Nazi Germany, 1937,” a show at the Neue Galerie, is one of the few in an American museum in the past two decades to address the Nazi’s selective demonizing of art.

headline.print_headline: First, They Came for the Art
headline.seo: ‘Degenerate Art,’ at Neue Galerie, Recalls Nazi Censorship
headline.main: First, They Came for the Art
